Module ntnu.idatt1002
Package ntnu.idatt1002.dao

Class UserStateDAO

java.lang.Object
ntnu.idatt1002.dao.UserStateDAO
public final class UserStateDAO
extends java.lang.Object
The class UserStateDAO provides static methods for handling the two state files under 'resources/saves/': 'userstate.ser' and 'loggedusers.ser'. 'userstates.ser' keeps track of the programs state: user currently logged in, category selected, sorting method selected and if the user has pressed 'remember me'. 'loggedusers.ser' contains every user that is logged in, and is used to easily log in and out from different users at the login screen.

    • getUsername

      public static java.lang.String getUsername()
      Returns the username of the User currently logged in to the program.
      Returns:
      a String containing the username. null if nobody is logged in.

    • getSelectedCategory

      public static java.lang.String getSelectedCategory()
      Returns the currently selected category.
      Returns:
      a String containing the category. null if no category is selected.

    • getSelectedSort

      public static java.lang.String getSelectedSort()
      Returns the currently selected sorting method.
      Returns:
      a String containing the sorting method. null if no sorting method is selected.

    • getRememberMe

      public static boolean getRememberMe()
      Check if the 'remember me' button has been checked.
      Returns:
      true or false.

    • setUserState

      public static void setUserState​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String selectedCategory, java.lang.String selectedSort, boolean rememberMe)
      Set current state of the program.
      Parameters:
      username - user currently logged in.
      selectedCategory - what category is selected.
      selectedSort - what sorting method is selected.
      rememberMe - if the user will be remembered to next start up.

    • getLoggedInUsers
